entry.title: Willie Hernández (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Puerto Rico's Willie Hernández (pictured) became the highest paid player in Detroit Tigers history after winning Cy Young and Most Valuable Player awards and a World Series?

entry.title: The Story of Mr Sommer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that The Story of Mr Sommer, a 1991 novella by Patrick Süskind with illustrations by Sempé, has been described as "a children's tale for adults"?

entry.title: KECH 22 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that KECH 22 was associated with two simultaneous bankruptcy proceedings?

entry.title: Brian McMahon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that medical doctor Brian McMahon was named "ANZAC of the Year" in 2011?

entry.title: Sofia the First (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Sofia the First was deemed "risky" but subsequently became the most-viewed program in its category?

entry.title: Yesenia Yarhui (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Yesenia Yarhui, the youngest parliamentarian in Bolivian history, was sworn into the Chamber of Deputies at just 19 years old?

entry.title: West Farms Soldiers Cemetery (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the soldier guarding the West Farms Soldiers Cemetery went missing for six years?

entry.title: Quest (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that players of the fantasy play-by-mail game Quest once voted on the game's "most useless item"?
